intro: Stackhousia aspericocca, commonly known as the rough-stemmed stackhousia, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems covered in rough, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a leathery texture. Stackhousia aspericocca is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
